intro: Anil secundiflora, commonly known as the Mexican starfruit or yellow starwood, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other well-known plants like the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in subtropical regions.
